title: Did You Know?
fact: Honey never spoils. Archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still perfectly edible.

title: Fun Fact
fact: Octopuses have three hearts: two pump blood to the gills, and one pumps it to the rest of the body.

title: Trivia
fact: The world's largest desert is not the Sahara; it's Antarctica.

title: Amazing Fact
fact: Bananas are berries, but strawberries are not!

title: Did You Know?
fact: A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance'.

title: Fun Fact
fact: Cows have best friends and can become stressed when separated from them.

title: Trivia
fact: The shortest war in history was between Britain and Zanzibar on August 27, 1896. Zanzibar surrendered after 38 minutes.

title: Amazing Fact
fact: A day on Venus lasts longer than a year on Venus.

title: Did You Know?
fact: Penguins can't taste sweet or savory flavors, only salty and sour.

title: Fun Fact
fact: The word 'alphabet' comes from the first two letters of the Greek alphabet: alpha and beta.

title: Trivia
fact: Your taste buds have a lifespan of about 10 to 14 days.

title: Amazing Fact
fact: Wombat poop is cube-shaped to prevent it from rolling away.

title: Did You Know?
fact: The Eiffel Tower can grow by more than 6 inches during hot weather, due to the expansion of iron.

title: Fun Fact
fact: The unicorn is the national animal of Scotland.

title: Trivia
fact: The world's smallest bone is in your ear, called the stapes bone.

title: Amazing Fact
fact: Humans and giraffes have the same number of neck vertebrae. Despite their long necks, giraffes have only seven.
